title: Alcoa (AA) Soars as Aluminum Prices Hit 17-Month High Amidst Green Energy Boom
summary: Aluminum prices surged to over $2,900 per tonne in late October and early November 2025, driven by China's production caps, new environmental regulations, supply disruptions including a major fire at Novelis' U.S. facility, geopolitical unrest in Guinea, and Alcoa's refinery closure in Australia. These factors, combined with low LME inventories, have tightened supply and pushed prices to a 17-month high.

title: Aluminum price hits three-year high as US-China truce buoys outlook
summary: Aluminum futures on the London Metal Exchange reached $2,902 a metric ton, the highest since May 2022, supported by China's production caps and easing US-China trade tensions. Despite positive demand outlooks, risks remain due to slowing momentum in China's economy, with recent manufacturing surveys showing declines.

title: Aluminum Prices Surging: Bull Run Amid Supply Crunches
summary: Global aluminum prices have surged to a five-month high, reaching around $2,710 a tonne on November 7, 2025, driven by economic growth, supply concerns, and the impact of China's production caps. Supply constraints are exacerbated by halted bauxite exports from Guinea and reduced output from Australia and Jamaica, causing inventories to drop to their lowest since 2015.

title: CBA CEO signals Brazilian aluminum export shift
summary: The CEO of Companhia Brasileira de Alumínio (CBA) highlighted a strategic shift in Brazilian aluminum exports towards ingots due to demand changes. Despite tariffs and rising competition, CBA maintains competitiveness with low-carbon products and expects US inventory depletion to increase demand by year-end, pushing premiums higher.

title: Aluminium rises on improved supply and demand prospects
summary: Benchmark aluminum on the London Metal Exchange rose 0.7% to $2,871 a metric ton, reaching highs near $2,920 amid improved supply and demand outlooks. The market reflects tightening supply conditions and positive demand signals.

title: [SMM Aluminum Express News] Aluminum prices surged to their highest level since May 2022
summary: Aluminum prices surged 0.9% to $2,909.50 per ton on the London Metal Exchange, marking the highest level since May 2022. The rally is supported by tightening supply and improving demand fundamentals.

title: Aluminum Rises Toward 3-Year High
summary: Aluminum futures rose toward $2,730 per tonne in October, reaching the highest level in three years due to expectations of lower supply. China has capped its aluminum output at 45 million tons, which is expected to be breached this year, while Alcoa announced the closure of its Kwinana alumina refinery in Australia, further tightening supply.

title: Alcoa (AA) Soars as Aluminum Prices Hit 17-Month High Amidst Green Energy Boom
summary: Aluminum prices surged to over $2,900 per tonne in late October and early November 2025, driven by China's strict production caps, new environmental regulations, and supply disruptions including a major fire at Novelis' Oswego facility and Alcoa's refinery closure. These factors, combined with geopolitical unrest and low inventories, have created a tight market and pushed prices to a 17-month high.

title: Century Aluminum Q3 2025 slides: Sequential growth amid missed expectations
summary: Century Aluminum reported sequential growth in Q3 2025 despite missing some expectations. The company is progressing on a new smelter project expected to take 4-6 years and create thousands of jobs, aiming to address the U.S. aluminum deficit. It projects increased shipments and improved EBITDA in Q4 2025 based on favorable market prices.

title: Aluminum Prices Surging: Bull Run Amid Supply Crunches
summary: Aluminum prices are expected to surge due to China's elimination of subsidies, supply constraints from Guinea's bauxite export halt, and production cuts by Russian producer Rusal. Chinese smelters face supply shortages with ore inventories at their lowest since 2015, while global supply tightens due to reduced output from Australia and Jamaica.

title: CBA CEO signals Brazilian aluminum export shift
summary: Brazilian aluminum producer CBA is shifting its product mix toward ingots to meet demand and redirecting volumes from U.S. to European customers amid tariff-driven market changes. Despite increased competition and tariffs, CBA maintains a competitive advantage with low-carbon products and strong client relationships, while U.S. Midwest aluminum premiums hit historic highs due to inventory depletion.

title: Mexico Ends Anti-Dumping Duty on China's Aluminum Discs
summary: Mexico has terminated the anti-dumping duty of US$1.17/kg on aluminum discs imported from China, effective November 7, 2025. This move may affect trade flows and pricing in the aluminum disc market.

title: Rapid Rise in Alumina Prices Elevates Aluminum Smelting Costs
summary: Alumina price spikes have driven up aluminum smelting costs by over 7% in November 2025, impacting the overall cost structure of aluminum production globally.

title: Ball Corporation Launches Carbon-Free Aerosol Can with ELYSIS
summary: Ball Corporation, in partnership with Alcoa and Unilever, has introduced a carbon-free aerosol can made using ELYSIS aluminum technology, which eliminates direct greenhouse gas emissions from the smelting process. This marks a significant step in sustainable packaging for personal and home care products.

title: Alcoa, Ball and Unilever Partner to Launch the First Use of ELYSIS Carbon-Free Smelting Technology in Consumer Personal and Home Care Packaging
summary: Alcoa, Ball, and Unilever have partnered to launch the first consumer packaging made with ELYSIS carbon-free aluminum, a technology that eliminates direct greenhouse gas emissions from aluminum smelting. This initiative sets a new benchmark for low-carbon packaging in the industry.

title: Aerosol Can Features Elysis Primary Aluminum, Recycled Content
summary: A new aerosol can launched by Alcoa, Ball, and Unilever features ELYSIS primary aluminum and recycled content, marking the first use of carbon-free smelting technology in consumer packaging. The product combines sustainability with innovation, reducing the carbon footprint of everyday packaging.

title: Alcoa, Ball and Unilever Partner to Launch Decarbonisation Initiative
summary: Alcoa, Ball Corporation, and Unilever have teamed up to launch the first use of ELYSIS carbon-free smelting technology in consumer personal and home care packaging, setting a new standard for sustainable aluminum production and packaging.

title: Steel Prices in the First Week of November 2025
summary: Steel prices for key products such as rebar, wire rod, HR coil, and CR coil are reported for the first week of November 2025, with FOB prices from CIS, Turkey, and Russia showing moderate levels. The data reflects current international market conditions and regional pricing trends.

title: Price Difference Between Steel Coil and Steel Screw Contracts
summary: On November 7, the price gap between the main contract for steel coil and steel screw was 154 yuan/ton, down 10 yuan/ton from the previous day. This reflects ongoing volatility and narrowing margins in the Chinese steel futures market.

title: China Steel Glut Threatens Japan Trading Houses in 2025
summary: China's record steel exports in 2025, exceeding 100 million tons annually, are causing market disruption and financial pressure on Japan's major trading houses. The oversupply is driven by weak domestic demand and unchanged production capacity, leading to aggressive export strategies.

title: Metallus Announces Third-Quarter 2025 Results
summary: Metallus reports Q3 2025 results and provides an outlook for Q4, noting lower expected shipments and adjusted EBITDA due to seasonality and supply chain issues. The company anticipates a slight increase in base prices for bar and tube products, with extended lead times into early 2026.

title: 150 Small Steel Mills in India Halt Production Due to Low Prices
summary: Approximately 150 small steel mills in India have suspended operations because of excessively low steel prices, highlighting the financial strain on smaller producers amid challenging market conditions.

title: JSW Steel Ltd: Live Stock Update and Price as of November 07, 2025
summary: JSW Steel Ltd's share price rose by 0.15% to ₹1,155.70, reflecting positive market sentiment despite broader industry challenges. The update provides real-time insight into investor confidence in one of India's largest steel producers.

title: Steel and petrochemical restructuring
summary: South Korea's steel industry is facing a severe downturn due to oversupply, weak domestic demand, and global protectionism. The government has introduced a Steel Industry Advancement Plan aimed at reducing production capacity for rebar and other general-purpose steel products, alongside limited financial aid to export-oriented firms. However, critics warn that without stronger measures to offset losses or ease cost pressures, the plan may fail to achieve meaningful reform.

title: Trump expands critical minerals list to copper, met coal, uranium
summary: The Trump administration added 10 minerals, including metallurgical coal used for steel production, to the U.S. critical minerals list to boost domestic mining and reduce reliance on imports from China. This expansion supports federal investments and incentives to secure materials vital for defense, manufacturing, and clean energy, aiming to strengthen U.S. supply chains against global disruptions.

title: Metallus Announces Third-Quarter 2025 Results
summary: Metallus reported its Q3 2025 financial results and highlighted a new long-term supply agreement for vacuum arc remelt (VAR) steel, securing a stable, high-quality steel source to support growth in aerospace and defense markets. The company is targeting $250 million in annual aerospace and defense sales by mid-2026 and continues labor negotiations with the United Steelworkers union.

title: A billion lessons for green iron in Australia
summary: Australia is investing $1 billion in developing a green iron industry, aiming to learn from the experiences of Europe and the US in transitioning to sustainable steel production. The initiative reflects growing global interest in decarbonizing steel manufacturing to meet environmental goals.

title: SKF Presents a Novel Bearing Steel Designed to Enable the Next Generation of Aeroengine Technology
summary: SKF has introduced a new bearing steel that accelerates development cycles and supports future sustainability goals in the aerospace industry. This innovation is expected to enhance performance and durability in next-generation aeroengines.

title: Steel's Carbon Emissions Dilemma: Retrofitting Plants Offers Big Cuts
summary: A recent study published in Nature explores the potential for retrofitting existing iron and steel plants to significantly reduce carbon emissions. The findings highlight both the environmental benefits and economic challenges of upgrading current infrastructure.

title: Composite Metal Foam Could Lead to Safer Hazmat Transportation
summary: A new study reveals that composite metal foam (CMF) can withstand extreme forces, making it a promising material for safer transportation of hazardous materials. This innovation could significantly improve safety standards in the steel and transportation sectors.

title: Africa's Two Major Copper Exporting Countries Reopen Trade Routes
summary: Two major African copper-exporting countries, Zambia and Tanzania, have reopened a key trade route after post-election disruptions. The reopening has restored copper and cobalt transportation via the Dar es Salaam port, with border authorities clearing about 250 trucks daily. LME copper prices fluctuated overnight, closing lower at $10,687/mt, while SHFE copper also saw a slight decline.

title: Copper - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Copper prices rose to 4.99 USD/lb on November 6, up 0.39% from the previous day, but have declined 1.28% over the past month. Despite recent volatility, copper remains 13.07% higher than a year ago, with forecasts predicting further increases in the coming months.

title: Copper prices drop on Fed policy uncertainty and Codelco supply
summary: Copper prices fell on renewed uncertainty about US interest rates and easing supply concerns after positive production signals from Chilean miner Codelco. LME copper dropped as much as 2.4% to around $10,855 per tonne, while COMEX prices hovered near $5.013 per pound.

title: Lundin Mining Reports Third Quarter 2025 Results and Increases Full-Year Copper Production Guidance and Lowers Cost Guidance
summary: Lundin Mining reported strong Q3 2025 results with copper production exceeding earlier quarters. The company increased its full-year copper production guidance by 11,500 tonnes to a midpoint of 328,000 tonnes and lowered its consolidated copper cash cost guidance to $1.85 to $2.00 per pound, reflecting improved operational performance, especially at Caserones and Chapada.

title: Avino Announces Q3 2025 Financial Results
summary: Avino reported a 7% decrease in silver production and a 26% decrease in copper production in Q3 2025 compared to Q3 2024, producing 263,231 silver ounces and 1.3 million pounds of copper. The decline was attributed to lower feed grades in the mine plan, partially offset by a 21% increase in mill throughput due to operational upgrades.

title: Trump expands critical minerals list to copper, met coal, uranium
summary: The U.S. administration expanded its critical minerals list to include copper, metallurgical coal, and uranium, emphasizing copper's importance for electric vehicles, power grids, and data centers. This move aims to boost domestic mining, reduce reliance on imports from China, and guide federal investments and incentives to secure supply chains for defense and clean energy technologies.

title: Kenadyr Provides Operational Update on the Adelita Copper-Gold-Silver Project and Status Update of Reactivation Transaction
summary: Kenadyr Metals Corp. announced the commencement of Phase 1 exploration at the Adelita Copper-Gold-Silver Project, including drilling and geochemical surveys. The project is fully permitted with a 20-year mining license, and the company is progressing with a reactivation transaction to consolidate 100% ownership, awaiting final TSXV approval.

title: Copper Added to New USGS Critical Minerals List
summary: American Pacific Mining highlighted copper's addition to the U.S. Geological Survey's 2025 critical minerals list. The company reported high-grade copper intercepts at its Palmer Copper-Zinc VMS Project in Alaska, with recent drilling showing significant copper and zinc grades, supporting increased contained copper resources.

title: Sustainable Copper Mining: Top Innovations For 2026 & Beyond
summary: Sustainable copper mining integrates advanced technologies such as satellite imaging, drones, AI analytics, and advanced water recycling systems to optimize excavation, minimize environmental disturbance, and reduce fresh water use by up to 50%. These innovations aim to reduce the environmental footprint of copper mining significantly by 2026 and beyond.

title: Kamoto Copper Company: Powering a New Era of Responsible Resource Development in the DRC
summary: Kamoto Copper Company is leveraging digital tools like sensors and data analytics to enhance transparency, efficiency, and accountability in copper and cobalt mining. This supports the global transition to cleaner energy by providing responsibly sourced materials, with a focus on ethical provenance and sustainability in the Democratic Republic of Congo.

title: Vedanta Resources launches US-domiciled CopperTech Metals
summary: Vedanta Resources launched CopperTech Metals to operate Konkola Copper Mines in Zambia, aiming to increase copper production to 500,000 tonnes per year. This initiative addresses U.S. supply chain security and supports clean energy and industrial progress through innovation and geographic diversification of copper supply.

title: BHP's Copper Boom: Sustainable Mining to Meet Soaring Global Demand
summary: BHP reported record copper production with a 28% increase since FY22, emphasizing copper's role in energy transition technologies and urban development. The company is investing in sustainable mining practices, including recycled copper, to support a lower-carbon future and meet rising global demand.

title: How Nuton is redefining copper for a low-impact future
summary: Nuton, a Rio Tinto venture, is pioneering bioleach technologies that enable cleaner and more efficient copper production with a reduced environmental footprint. Their data-driven and nature-based approach aims to unlock new copper resources while supporting the energy transition responsibly.

title: Teck Highlights Progress on Quebrada Blanca Ramp up, Pathway to Full Potential, and Value Delivery to Shareholders from Merger
summary: Teck Resources is advancing the Quebrada Blanca copper project with new technology upgrades and construction milestones, aiming to become a top-five global copper producer. The planned merger with Anglo American will enhance scale, resilience, and financial strength, supporting long-term sustainable growth in copper production.

title: Nickel Price Update: Q3 2025 in Review
summary: Nickel prices were volatile in the first half of 2025 but stabilized in Q3 amid ongoing oversupply concerns driven mainly by rapid production growth in Indonesia. Despite rising demand, the market remains structurally oversupplied, with LME nickel stockpiles increasing significantly through the third quarter. The end of the US EV tax credit on September 30 may also impact future nickel demand in the electric vehicle sector.

title: Nickel Prices: Falling Stainless Prices Drag Suppliers
summary: Chinese primary nickel prices fell 7.06% to $15,940 per metric ton, while Indian prices dropped 8.54%, reflecting a bearish trend in nickel following a decline in stainless steel prices. The stainless steel market remains weak due to contraction in the U.S. manufacturing sector, with major producers reporting year-over-year sales declines, further pressuring nickel demand and prices.

title: Nickel Futures Fall to Over 1-Month Low
summary: Nickel futures dropped below $15,100 per tonne, the lowest level in over a month, due to continued oversupply from Indonesia. Indonesian production has flooded global supply chains, pushing LME inventories to a record high of 308,000 tons. In response, Indonesia has tightened production quotas and mining permit regulations to stabilize prices.

title: Stellantis terminates Alliance Nickel offtake deal
summary: Stellantis has ended its nickel offtake agreement with Alliance due to falling nickel prices and tighter financing conditions, which have delayed project progress. The termination reflects the challenging market environment for nickel amid price declines and financial constraints.

title: First Atlantic Nickel to Attend North American Stainless & Special Alloys Conference 2025
summary: First Atlantic Nickel announced its participation in the North American Stainless & Special Alloys Conference, highlighting its Pipestone XL Nickel Alloy Project. The project features a unique nickel-iron-cobalt alloy mineral, awaruite, which allows for smelter-free processing and supports a resilient domestic supply chain amid ongoing nickel market volatility and oversupply concerns.

title: Alliance Nickel's Offtake Agreement with Stellantis to be Renegotiated
summary: Alliance Nickel announced that Stellantis has provided notice of termination for their binding offtake agreement effective December 3, 2025, due to missed contractual milestones amid challenging nickel market conditions. Stellantis remains interested in renegotiating terms aligned with the revised project timeline and market environment. Alliance Nickel is also exploring strategic alternatives including a potential SPAC transaction for a Nasdaq listing.

title: Indonesia limits new nickel permits to add value to production
summary: Indonesia has stopped approving new permits for nickel plants producing intermediate products like nickel pig iron and mixed hydroxide precipitate unless they plan further processing. This move aims to push the world's largest nickel producer further up the value chain and address oversupply issues. The regulation may delay or cancel projects finishing after 2027, impacting the nickel industry's growth trajectory in Indonesia.

title: First Atlantic Nickel to Attend North American Stainless & Special Alloys Conference 2025
summary: First Atlantic Nickel announced its participation in the North American Stainless & Special Alloys Conference to showcase its Pipestone XL Nickel Alloy Project. The project features a unique nickel-iron-cobalt alloy mineral that allows smelter-free processing, reducing energy use and environmental impact. This discovery in Newfoundland addresses critical supply chain vulnerabilities for nickel, cobalt, and chromium in North America.

title: Indonesia tightens nickel smelter licensing, limits new projects
summary: The Indonesian government has officially restricted new investment permits for nickel smelters by tightening licensing requirements. This policy aims to push the nickel industry towards higher value-added processing and control the rapid expansion of smelting capacity. The move is expected to impact new projects and investment decisions in Indonesia's nickel sector.

title: Caraga faces environmental damage from nickel mining
summary: The Caraga region is experiencing environmental damage due to nickel mining activities. The report highlights concerns over ecological degradation and the impact on local communities. This situation underscores the environmental challenges associated with nickel production in mining regions.

title: Canada Nickel Zero-Carbon Industrial Cluster Hub
summary: Canada Nickel Company is pioneering a zero-carbon industrial cluster in Ontario that transforms mining waste into hydrogen, fertilizer, and carbon storage products. This innovative approach integrates carbon sequestration technology with mining operations to create a carbon-negative industrial ecosystem, enhancing project economics and supporting regional decarbonization goals.

title: Genomines raises $45M to grow nickel from plants, not mines
summary: French start-up Genomines secured $45 million in Series A funding to scale its novel nickel extraction method using plants that hyperaccumulate nickel from soil. This phytoextraction technology offers faster deployment and lower costs than traditional mining, producing nickel concentrates with significantly higher purity, and aims to rebalance global mineral supply chains sustainably.

title: First Atlantic Nickel to Attend North American Stainless & Special Alloys Conference 2025
summary: First Atlantic Nickel will showcase its Pipestone XL Nickel Alloy Project, which features a smelter-free processing method using awaruite, a nickel-iron-cobalt alloy mineral. This technology reduces energy use and environmental impact by eliminating overseas smelting, supporting a resilient North American critical minerals supply chain for nickel, cobalt, and chromium.

title: Commission opens in-depth investigation into the proposed acquisition of Anglo American's nickel business by MMG
summary: The European Commission has launched an in-depth investigation into MMG's proposed acquisition of Anglo American's nickel business, citing concerns that MMG could divert ferronickel supply away from European markets. This could increase costs and reduce quality for European stainless steel producers, impacting the critical nickel supply chain in Europe.

title: Australian battery system technology to be assessed for SSN-AUKUS nuclear-powered submarines
summary: Australian nickel zinc battery technology developed by PMB Defence Engineering is set for assessment to integrate into the SSN-AUKUS nuclear-powered submarine program. This innovation highlights the strategic role of nickel-based battery systems in advanced defense applications, emphasizing sustainability and performance.

title: Italy's Tenaris posts surprise 2% rise in sales on stable US, Canada drilling activity
summary: Italian steel pipe maker Tenaris reported a surprise 2% increase in third-quarter net sales to $2.98 billion, its first revenue rise in eight quarters, driven by stable drilling activity in North America. However, the company warned that margins would be affected by the full impact of tariff costs, with European steel producers operating at reduced capacity due to tariffs and import restrictions.

title: Tenaris Announces 2025 Third Quarter Results
summary: Tenaris reported a 7% decrease in sales for the first nine months of 2025 compared to 2024, with a 2% volume decline and 4% price decline in tubular products. EBITDA decreased by 6%, though EBITDA margin slightly increased. The company approved an interim dividend of $0.29 per share and noted impacts from U.S. antidumping deposits and ongoing litigation provisions.

title: Tenaris Reports Surprise 2% Rise in Q3 Sales
summary: Tenaris surprised markets with its first revenue growth in eight quarters during Q3 2025, reporting a 2% sales increase to $2.98 billion. The report provides detailed market insights including product coverage, country-specific trade data for Italy, and forecasts for market dynamics, aimed at helping manufacturers and investors make informed decisions.

title: BofA Sees Growth Potential for Prysmian from US Tariffs
summary: Bank of America estimates Prysmian could raise copper cable prices by 10%, potentially increasing 2026 EBITDA by up to EUR1 billion due to US tariffs on copper imports. Prysmian's copper cable production is largely US-based, benefiting from tariffs averaging 41% on imports, especially in medium- and low-voltage segments. HSBC also notes strong fiber optic cable business growth, with Prysmian shares trading near all-time highs.

title: Prysmian Q2 2025 slides: EBITDA margins expand, outlook upgraded amid strong cash flow
summary: Prysmian reported record Q2 EBITDA of €605 million, up from €457 million the previous year, with improved EBITDA margins reflecting operational efficiency. The company upgraded its full-year outlook, driven by strong performance in transmission and data center segments. Potential risks include new US copper tariffs and increased competition in high voltage transmission.

title: Prysmian Could Be a Relative Winner From Trump's Copper Tariff
summary: Citi analysts suggest Prysmian may benefit from President Trump's proposed 50% tariff on copper due to its vertically integrated US copper operations, including sourcing from a Freeport mine and a copper rod mill in Texas. This gives Prysmian a competitive edge over smaller players, potentially driving share price gains.
